verses.arabicVerse: فَمَنْ ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
simpleTranslate: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the
successful.
tafsirTranslate: Then only those whose Scales will be heavy, <N:95> will attain success;

95: That is, those whose good deeds will be heavy and will out-weigh their evil

verses.arabicVerse: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ فِي جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدُونَ
simpleTranslate: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls,
[being] in Hell, abiding eternally.
tafsirTranslate: and those, whose scales will be light, will be the people who made themselves
liable to loss <N:96> they shall abide in Hell for ever.

96: For the criterion of ["success"] and ["failure"] in the Hereafter, please refer

verses.arabicVerse: تَلْفَحُ وُجُوهَهُمُ النَّارُ وَهُمْ فِيهَا كَالِحُونَ
simpleTranslate: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.
tafsirTranslate: The "Fire" will scorch their faces so as to expose their jaws <N:97>

97: The word kalih means a face whose skin has been removed so as to expose the jaws.
When somebody asked Hadrat `Abdullah bin Mas`ud the meaning of kalih, he said,
["Haven't you seen the scorched head of a slaughtered animal?"]

verses.arabicVerse: أَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَكُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
simpleTranslate: [It will be said]. "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"
tafsirTranslate: -(It will be said to them,) "Are you not the same people, who treated as lies My
Revelations, when they were recited to you?"

verses.arabicVerse: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا غَلَبَتْ عَلَيْنَا شِقْوَتُنَا وَكُنَّا قَوْمًا ضَالِّينَ
simpleTranslate: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people
astray.
tafsirTranslate: They will say, "Our Lord, our bad luck prevailed over us, and we were, indeed,
erring people.

verses.arabicVerse: رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَالِمُونَ
simpleTranslate: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed
be wrongdoers."
tafsirTranslate: Our Lord, now take us out of this place: after this, if we be guilty of such a
thing, we shall indeed be wrong-doers."

verses.arabicVerse: قَالَ اخْسَئُوا فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونِ
simpleTranslate: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.
tafsirTranslate: In answer to this, Allah will say, "Get away from here, remain herein and do not
speak to Me. <N:98>

98: ["....do not speak to Me"] ["...do not plead your case with Me."] According to

to speak again, but this is contradicted by the Qur'an itself in the succeeding
verses. Therefore, it only means this that they will not be able to plead their

verses.arabicVerse: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فَرِيقٌ مِنْ عِبَادِي يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا وَارْحَمْنَا وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
simpleTranslate: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed,
so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
tafsirTranslate: For, you are the very same people, who made fun of some of Our servants when they
prayed to Us, `Our Lord, we have believed: so forgive us and have mercy, on us,
for You are the Most Merciful of alI who show mercy?

verses.arabicVerse: فَاتَّخَذْتُمُوهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا حَتَّىٰ أَنْسَوْكُمْ ذِكْرِي وَكُنْتُمْ مِنْهُمْ تَضْحَكُونَ
simpleTranslate: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My
remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
tafsirTranslate: So much so that in your obduracy, you even forgot My very existence, and went on
scoffing at them.

verses.arabicVerse: إِنِّي جَزَيْتُهُمُ الْيَوْمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا أَنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ
simpleTranslate: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are
the attainers [of success]."
tafsirTranslate: Today I have recompensed them .for their fortitude, and they have triumphed over

verses.arabicVerse: قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ
simpleTranslate: [ Allah ] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"
tafsirTranslate: Then Allah will inquire from them, "For how many years did you live on the
Earth?"

verses.arabicVerse: قَالُوا لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَاسْأَلِ الْعَادِّينَ
simpleTranslate: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."
tafsirTranslate: They will say, "We stayed there for a day or for part of a day. <N:100>

100: For explanation, see Ta Ha [(XX)]: 103 and E.N. 80 thereof.

verses.arabicVerse: قَالَ إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ لَوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
simpleTranslate: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.
tafsirTranslate: You may inquire from those who kept account." It will be said, "Well, you know
now that you stayed there for a little while only. What a pity! you did not
realize it then. <N:101>

101: That is, ["Our Messengers warned you that the life in this world is transitory
and is for test and trial, but you did not realize it then and denied that there
was any life in the Hereafter and behaved in accordance with that belief."]

verses.arabicVerse: أَفَحَسِبْتُمْ أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ
simpleTranslate: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be
returned?"
tafsirTranslate: Did you think that We had created you without any purpose, <N:102> and that you
would never be brought back to Us?"

102: The Arabic word `abathan in the Text also means ["for the sake of sport"]. Then
the verse will mean: ["Did you think that We had created you merely for the sake
of sport and there was no purpose behind your creation ? Therefore you may eat,
drink, be merry and enjoy yourself as you please. "]

verses.arabicVerse: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيمِ
simpleTranslate: So exalted is Allah , the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him,
Lord of the Noble Throne.
tafsirTranslate: So Exalted is Allah, <N:103> the and real Sovereign. There is no god other than
He: He is the Lord of the Glorious Throne.

103: Allah is above this that He should create you without any purpose and that you
may associate partners with Him with impunity.

verses.arabicVerse: وَمَنْ يَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ لَا بُرْهَانَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الْكَافِرُونَ
simpleTranslate: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then
his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
tafsirTranslate: Therefore, if some one invokes any other deity along with Allah, whereof he has
no proof, <N:104> he shall have to give an account to his Lord. <N:105> Such
disbelievers can never attain "success" <N:106>

104: It may also be translated as: ["The one who invokes any other deity along with
Allah, has nothing to support him in this act."]
105: That is, he cannot escape accountability.
